sentence.Network_en: Her manner offstage, like her manner on, is somewhat surly.
sentence.Network_cn: 她台下和台上的举止如出一辙，都有些粗暴无礼。

list.abs: a surly person , look , refusal., 粗暴的人 , 样子 , 拒绝.
I do not like his surly look ., 我不喜欢他那粗暴的样子.
I began to be a little surly with him ., 我对他开始有点生气.
She is always so surly ; she never smiles at anyone ., 她总是那么个坏脾气 , 对谁也没有一个笑脸.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'lordly, haughty, arrogant'): alteration of obsolete sirly (see sir, -ly)

entry.tran: 暴躁的;粗暴无礼的;乖戾的
entry.def: Someone who is surly behaves in a rude bad-tempered way.

example.ex: He became surly and rude towards me.

means.word_mean: 1. inclined to anger or bad feelings with overtones of menace;

sentences.en: The surly insolence of the waiters drove him into a rage,and he flung his serviette to the floor and stalked out of the restaurant.
sentences.cn: 侍者们粗暴无礼的行为使得他怒不可遏,他将餐巾扔到地上,愤然走出餐厅。
